trends: There have been no other sightings in Glen Ellen
This sighting has never been favorited.
divs: Sighting Detailsin the summer of 1990 it was a very warm nite at about midnite maybe a bit later maybe 1 am.i stepped out into the front yard for some fresh air. the house was on a small hill as i turned to go back up the walk to the house i noticed to my right an object which at first i thought was a meteor. as i watched it i realized it was too big and too slow to be a meteor. it was huge.a long thick flaming green tail. it was consistently the same shape, length and width and color. an even gold green glow with a bit of sparkle. mostly green though. i was amazed by what i was watching. it was a about the length of my index finger held up at arms length. it was moving west over the sears point area towards petaluma and the coast. for as long as i watched it it did not slow down speed up or lose or gain altitude or change shape or brightness except for the faint flickering of the flame like tail. eventually after some minutes of watching i finished turning to go back into the house
Summary: in the distance i saw a very large flaming green/gold object with a huge tail traveling level to the horizon
